content:
• Wednesday, May 30, 2012
  • FSLR

    The imposition of tariffs on Chinese rivals hasn't done much to help First Solar (FSLR -5.8%),...

    The imposition of tariffs on Chinese rivals hasn't done much to help First Solar (FSLR -5.8%), which closed today at new all-time lows. Not helping matters was another bearish note (previous) from Axiom's Gordon Johnson, who believes First Solar could be forced to buy back three large-scale projects to keep them running. Johnson also warns any product recall related to large-scale projects could trigger a "liquidity event," and potentially bankruptcy.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • LGF.A

    More on Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ4 swings to a loss on higher marketing and acquisition...

    More on Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ4 swings to a loss on higher marketing and acquisition costs from its January acquisition of Summit Entertainment. Revenue surged 71% Y/Y on "The Hunger Games" box office receipts, as well as home entertainment sales of "The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn: Part 1.." Shares -5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) -6.1% AH after announcing sales chief Mark Anderson has resigned, and...

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) -6.1% AH after announcing sales chief Mark Anderson has resigned, and will be replaced by Americas sales VP Dave Feringa. Sales exec departures at enterprise IT companies often follow disappointing performances - BMC Software is a recent example. William Blair reported in April F5's sales force "was aggressive in trying to close deals" at the end of FQ2.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ4 EPS of -$0.17 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.27....

    Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ4 EPS of -$0.17 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.27. Revenue of $645.2M (+71% Y/Y) beats by $27M. Shares -3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • BHC

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG -28%) gets hammered into the close, ending the day at its low following...

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG -28%) gets hammered into the close, ending the day at its low following the announcement of preliminary FQ3 results late yesterday that missed analyst expectations. The medical-device company blames economic difficulties in Europe and order delays to its two key marketing partners.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • CWTR

    Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR): Q1 EPS of -$0.20 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $169.9M (-5.5% Y/Y)...

    Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR): Q1 EPS of -$0.20 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $169.9M (-5.5% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • TIVO

    TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO): Q1 EPS of -$0.17 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $54.5M (+16% Y/Y) misses by...

    TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO): Q1 EPS of -$0.17 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $54.5M (+16% Y/Y) misses by $0.4M. Shares -5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • OPEN

    Down sharply earlier in the day, OpenTable (OPEN +1.3%) spiked higher in the final hour of...

    Down sharply earlier in the day, OpenTable (OPEN +1.3%) spiked higher in the final hour of trading after it was learned the company's restaurant-booking service has been integrated with Google+ (NASDAQ:GOOG). OpenTable slumped last September following Google's acquisition of restaurant review provider Zagat.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • SWKS

    Mobile power amplifier vendors are heading into the close with big losses. SWKS -4.3%. RFMD...

    Mobile power amplifier vendors are heading into the close with big losses. SWKS -4.3%. RFMD -6.4%. AVGO -4%. TQNT -4.7%. Research In Motion's (RIMM -8%) FQ1 warning, which raises the prospect of another huge inventory write-down, could be contributing to the declines.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • E

    Italy's Eni (E -3.1%) agrees to sell its controlling stake in Italian natural gas grid Snam to...

    Italy's Eni (E -3.1%) agrees to sell its controlling stake in Italian natural gas grid Snam to lender Cassa Depositi e Prestiti, in a €3.52B ($4.4B) deal allowing the oil giant to free funds to finance its E&P expansion program. CDP will pay for the purchase by selling a 3% stake in Eni, worth ~€2B, on the market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -3.3%) survive, so to speak, another biting...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -3.3%) survive, so to speak, another biting comment from David Einhorn. Though the company isn't the main attraction of the report, it does get called out as not having an audit committee worth complimenting and for seeing weak Vue sales. It's also worth noting that reading between the lines, it appears Greenlight Capital may still be betting on more downside for GMCR.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • ETN

    Diversified industrial manufacturer Eaton (ETN -1.2%) names Ramanath Ramakrishnan as as its new...

    Diversified industrial manufacturer Eaton (ETN -1.2%) names Ramanath Ramakrishnan as as its new Chief Technology Officer effective June 1. He will succeeding Lennart Jonsson, who plans to remain with the company until June 15 to ensure a smooth transition.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • TOL

    While April's surprising 5.5% decline in pending home sales is nothing to celebrate,...

    While April's surprising 5.5% decline in pending home sales is nothing to celebrate, MKM Partners finds it consistent with its view of a choppy early-stage housing recovery, and isn't overly concerned that a recovery is at risk. The firm sticks with its call to buy homebuilder stocks (XHB -3.7%) such as Toll Brothers (TOL -5.8%) and Pulte (PHM -4.1%) on dips.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • NEON

    Microcap Neonode (NASDAQ:NEON) skyrockets 26.6% higher after James Altucher takes to SA to make...

    Microcap Neonode (NASDAQ:NEON) skyrockets 26.6% higher after James Altucher takes to SA to make the case it could be a $30 stock on the strength of its patent portfolio. Trading volume on NEON is over 20X its daily average.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • NCIT

    NCI (NCIT +20.4%) shares skyrocket after the company finds itself among 50-plus companies...

    NCI (NCIT +20.4%) shares skyrocket after the company finds itself among 50-plus companies pre-qualifying to compete for government task orders focused on health and biomedical-related IT services. Shares had been -65% YTD after the IT provider had cited uncertainty in the federal procurement environment.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • CALL

    MagicJack VocalTec (CALL -9.8%) plummets following a WSJ column that takes a critical look at...

    MagicJack VocalTec (CALL -9.8%) plummets following a WSJ column that takes a critical look at the company's strategy of financing stock buybacks by selling put options - a tactic often used by companies in the Dot.com bubble era, but rarely today. The put sales generated $1.6M in profits for magicJack in Q1 (20% of its total), when its shares were rallying, but stands to backfire with the recent decline in the company's stock price.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • MON

    Monsanto (MON +2.8%) rides above today's sagging market after it raised fiscal guidance for FQ3...

    Monsanto (MON +2.8%) rides above today's sagging market after it raised fiscal guidance for FQ3 and FY2012, citing sales boosted by a strong seed selling season in the Americas, and said strong growth would continue in 2013. MON earnings are due June 27; it has reported six straight positive earnings surprises. Shares are upgraded to Buy at Canaccord with a new price target of $89, up from $81.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • NOK

    On a rough day for Euro tech stocks, Nokia (NOK -6.6%) is falling harder than most, and is...

    On a rough day for Euro tech stocks, Nokia (NOK -6.6%) is falling harder than most, and is closing in on the month's lows. A downgrade to Sell from MKM Partners, which now has a $2 PT on the company, is contributing to the decline.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 8 Comments
  • WHR

    Shares of Whirlpool (WHR +4.0%) move up after the U.S. International Trade Administration rules...

    Shares of Whirlpool (WHR +4.0%) move up after the U.S. International Trade Administration rules that rivals Samsung and LG dumped washing machines in the U.S. at prices below fair value. The Commerce Department plans to tag duties on imports of washing machines as a temporary response to the practice.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • NAV

    Navistar (NAV -3.7%) is likely to lower FY12 guidance again by $1.00 or more when reporting next...

    Navistar (NAV -3.7%) is likely to lower FY12 guidance again by $1.00 or more when reporting next week due to recent market share weakness, according to Jefferies. The firm lowers its price target to $45 from $70 ahead of results on June 4. However, it maintains its Buy rating in the name, noting that the key for stock performance over the near-term hinges on the status of its 13L certification.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • XOM

    ExxonMobil (XOM -2.2%) is studying the possibility of exporting natural gas from the U.S. Gulf...

    ExxonMobil (XOM -2.2%) is studying the possibility of exporting natural gas from the U.S. Gulf Coast and Canada, CEO Rex Tillerson says. Dismissing critics who contend exports would raise the price of domestic natural gas, Tillerson says nat gas exports will create jobs, increase tax revenues and help the U.S. trade balance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • RDEA

    Ardea Biosciences (RDEA -0.1%) says it's earned a $7.5M milestone payment from Bayer...

    Ardea Biosciences (RDEA -0.1%) says it's earned a $7.5M milestone payment from Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY) under the terms of their April 2009 global license agreement to develop and commercialize RDEA's mitogen-activated ERK kinase inhibitor compounds for cancer and other indications. The milestone was triggered by the recent initiation of Phase 2 clinical studies. Separately, Gabelli says it's raised its stake in the company from 7.9% to 8.94%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • JOE

    St. Joe (JOE -6.4%) dives amidst renewed flogging by David Einhorn, who says the company...

    St. Joe (JOE -6.4%) dives amidst renewed flogging by David Einhorn, who says the company continues to carry property on its books at inflated values. Recognizing the marks will reveal the company was unable to make any money during the historic housing boom. If it couldn't do it then, when will it?

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • REGN

    Baird defends Regeneron (REGN -2.1%) this morning, saying the drug developer's downstream has...

    Baird defends Regeneron (REGN -2.1%) this morning, saying the drug developer's downstream has significant potential. The firm cites the beginning of REGN's Phase lll testing of REGN727 next month, plus FDA guidance that cardiovascular outcomes will not be a prerequisite for approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • CIEN

    Ciena (CIEN -5.2%) slumps ahead of tomorrow morning's FQ2 report, even though Needham is...

    Ciena (CIEN -5.2%) slumps ahead of tomorrow morning's FQ2 report, even though Needham is starting coverage with a Buy and $16 PT. The firm notes Ciena has an 85% share of the nascent market for 100G optical transmission gear, and touts the company's order pipeline and improving margins. Nomura is more cautious: the firm is slashing its estimates due to the optical networking industry's capex issues, but expects a 2H demand pickup.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (RVBD -3.9%) underperforms after Piper (Neutral) slashes its estimates and voices...

    Riverbed (RVBD -3.9%) underperforms after Piper (Neutral) slashes its estimates and voices concerns about the company's Euro exposure, as well as slowing growth in Riverbed's core WAN optimization hardware market. Riverbed's aggressive 2H guidance makes it particularly vulnerable to Europe's problems, in Piper's view. Gabelli took a more positive stance on WAN optimization demand last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • GG

    Goldcorp (GG +2.1%) could be enjoying a lift from a positive SA article predicting a possible...

    Goldcorp (GG +2.1%) could be enjoying a lift from a positive SA article predicting a possible 40% upside to GG shares, citing "several smart moves" to shore up the company's bottom line and a bullish outlook for the metal's price. Mining stocks are picking up as gold prices bounce off early lows: AUY +1.8%, ABX +1.5%, NEM +0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • KWK

    The energy sector (XLE -3%) is suffering the day's biggest losses, weighed by tumbling crude oil...

    The energy sector (XLE -3%) is suffering the day's biggest losses, weighed by tumbling crude oil futures which fell to seven-month lows as the dollar surges vs. the euro. Among the biggest decliners: KWK -8.3%, DNR -7%. Drilling equipment makers: RDC -6.8%, NE -5.2%, NBR -4.7%. Dow components: CVX -2.5%, XOM -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • AMRN

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN -3.5%) give back much of yesterday's pop on news that Teva Pharmaceutical...

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN -3.5%) give back much of yesterday's pop on news that Teva Pharmaceutical (NYSE:TEVA) and Par Pharmaceutical (NYSE:PRX) lost their bid to sell the generic form of Lovaza. The stock had rocketed higher on perceptions that the court ruling would clear the way for Amarin's AMR101 to launch and price without competition from generic Lovaza products.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • GME

    GameStop (GME +5.1%) runs up an impressive gain after Sony (SNE -3.2%) rejects an online-only...

    GameStop (GME +5.1%) runs up an impressive gain after Sony (SNE -3.2%) rejects an online-only game console for its next model. Sony say it plans on a 2013 release for the next-generation PlayStation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • ATRC

    Roth Capital defends AtriCure (ATRC -2.5%) this morning, saying that after meeting with...

    Roth Capital defends AtriCure (ATRC -2.5%) this morning, saying that after meeting with management it believes the shares are undervalued. The firm notes that a recent rebound in the company's base business isn't reflected in the share price and pipeline opportunities remain unappreciated. Roth thinks the company can significantly increase its revenue per procedure and reiterates a Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • FRO

    Shares of Frontline (FRO -11.1%) see a double-digit loss after Deutsche Bank slaps a downgrade...

    Shares of Frontline (FRO -11.1%) see a double-digit loss after Deutsche Bank slaps a downgrade to Sell on the company. Analysts cite the low quality of the tanker firm's fleet and find it hard to see any potential for upside earnings surprises in the near future.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • PCXCQ

    Coal shares (KOL -2.9%) slump as Patriot Coal (PCX -8%) is cut to Fair Value from Buy at...

    Coal shares (KOL -2.9%) slump as Patriot Coal (PCX -8%) is cut to Fair Value from Buy at CRT Capital in light of uncertainty around its refinancing status and weak cash flow outlook. The firm assigns 50-50 odds to two scenarios: the company files for Chapter 11 by year's end, or the liquidity crisis is averted. PCX and other coal names had gained yesterday after Goldman's kind words.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • CHK

    Bloomberg discusses Chesapeake (CHK -3%) as a potential takeover target due to its currently...

    Bloomberg discusses Chesapeake (CHK -3%) as a potential takeover target due to its currently depressed valuation. CHK’s equity and net debt are valued at $9.19 for each barrel of oil equivalent, Bloomberg calculates, lowest among U.S. oil and gas explorers with market caps greater than $5B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 3 Comments
  • KMX

    ITG drops a hammer on CarMax (KMX -5.6%) after channel checks indicate that comparable sales are...

    ITG drops a hammer on CarMax (KMX -5.6%) after channel checks indicate that comparable sales are growing in a 0% to 3% range, after Q4 came in at 7%. Sector peers AutoNation (AN -2.4%) and KAR Auction Services (KAR -2.7%) also trade weak in sympathy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • PPC

    Shares of Pilgrim's Pride (PPC -5.1%) trade lower after BB&T Capital chimes in with a...

    Shares of Pilgrim's Pride (PPC -5.1%) trade lower after BB&T Capital chimes in with a downgrade to Hold from Buy on margin concerns. It's a different story with producer Sanderson Farms (SAFM +1.4%), where higher wholesale chicken prices hit the bottom line in a more positive way.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • BIOF

    Biofuel Energy (BIOF -12.3%) unveils plans for a one-for-20 reverse stock split, as the ethanol...

    Biofuel Energy (BIOF -12.3%) unveils plans for a one-for-20 reverse stock split, as the ethanol production company looks to boost its stock price and to regain compliance for continued listing on Nasdaq.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • M

    NBG's Brian Sozzi notes that the downturn in shares of Macy's (M -2.4%) off of a seemingly...

    NBG's Brian Sozzi notes that the downturn in shares of Macy's (M -2.4%) off of a seemingly strong May same-store sales number could be tied to the weaker core number after online sales are stripped out.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • WMT

    Shares of Wal-Mart (WMT +0.5%) stay resilient in the face of stocks falling across the globe,...

    Shares of Wal-Mart (WMT +0.5%) stay resilient in the face of stocks falling across the globe, even managing to etch out yet another 52-week high in the process. At the company's annual meeting on Friday, shareholders will find out if the movement to oust current board members and increase transparency takes hold or if a 20% return over the last year is enough to keep a majority satisfied.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • ANIP

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) -7.4% to $0.46, although it's not clear what's pulling shares...

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) -7.4% to $0.46, although it's not clear what's pulling shares lower. The stock hit $0.34 on May 18, after which it went on a tear and rose to $0.53 three days later. Since then, it's whipsawed a bit.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) fall 7.5% - the most of any S&P 500 stock in early trading. SA...

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) fall 7.5% - the most of any S&P 500 stock in early trading. SA author Justin Weinstein says the stock is a risky play until the company successfully proves to consumers that it's able to turn around its fortunes.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 18 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk (SPLK -4.7%), which has rallied strongly in recent trading, is selling off after Drexel...

    Splunk (SPLK -4.7%), which has rallied strongly in recent trading, is selling off after Drexel Hamilton starts coverage with a Hold and $34 PT. While recognizing Splunk's big data credentials, the firm notes plenty of competition also exists. Splunk's S-1 claims indirect competitors include systems management software vendors (IBM, H-P, CA), web analytics vendors (Google, Adobe), and business intelligence software firms (IBM, Oracle, SAP), among others. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM

  • It's a new session low for the euro, -0.7% to $1.2422. Every tick down sets a new 2-year low for...

    It's a new session low for the euro, -0.7% to $1.2422. Every tick down sets a new 2-year low for the currency vs. the dollar. A bit of perspective: The currency first officially traded in January 1999 at about $1.18. It spent the next 22 months sinking, hitting an all-time low of $0.8230 in October 2000. There remains an ocean of room between here and there.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) -9.9% thanks to the FQ1 warning included in its "business update."...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) -9.9% thanks to the FQ1 warning included in its "business update." Virtually no analyst is willing to express a positive opinion on the company, and most are skeptical a buyer offering a significant premium will emerge. Baird considers it unlikely Microsoft or Facebook would have any interest, while Stene Agee believes a deal at or below current levels might be all RIM receives. Bernstein thinks the BB10 launch "will most likely turn into a disaster."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 9 Comments

  • Market Preview: Markets are whipsawing on the stormy sea that is the eurozone debt crisis (I,...

    Market Preview: Markets are whipsawing on the stormy sea that is the eurozone debt crisis (I, II, III), with most of Europe now lower along with U.S. stock futures. The S&P benchmark is -0.7%, while 10-year Treasury yields hit a fresh low. RIM is -10.95% following its profit warning yesterday, although Monsanto is +2.3% after raising its FY 2012 guidance. Later: Pending Home Sales, Lots of Fed speak
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • M

    Macy's (NYSE:M) announces same-store sales rose 4.1% Y/Y to $1.936B in May, while YTD sales are...

    Macy's (NYSE:M) announces same-store sales rose 4.1% Y/Y to $1.936B in May, while YTD sales are up 4.3% compared to last year. Shares -1.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • DRYS

    Wells Fargo says the weakness in shares of DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) could be a key buying...

    Wells Fargo says the weakness in shares of DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) could be a key buying opportunity after the company misfired with its Q1 report. Analysts keep the stock lined up with an Outperform rating on their view that the bottom line will improve in the next two quarters. Shares -4.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • NEON

    Premarket gainers: NEON +30%. OSIR +13%. ISR +5%. Losers: PBY-OLD -22%. PWRD -11%. RIMM -11%....

    Premarket gainers: NEON +30%. OSIR +13%. ISR +5%.
    Losers: PBY-OLD -22%. PWRD -11%. RIMM -11%. DRYS -7%. TTM -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • OSIR

    Stem cell company Osiris Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OSIR) +12.8% premarket after saying its Grafix...

    Stem cell company Osiris Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OSIR) +12.8% premarket after saying its Grafix treatments received pass-through status under Medicare's outpatient prospective payment system. The new codes will facilitate reimbursement when Grafix products are used to treat Medicare patients in hospital outpatient departments and ambulatory surgical centers.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • SDRL

    Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) -1.5% premarket after reducing its stake in Malaysian partner SapuraKencana...

    Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) -1.5% premarket after reducing its stake in Malaysian partner SapuraKencana Petroleum, selling 300M shares for ~$200M. Following the transaction, SDRL will continue to hold 319.5M shares in SapuraKencana, or a 6.4% stake.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM | 4 Comments
  • ENS

    Along with reporting FQ4 results, EnerSys (NYSE:ENS) affirmed its earnings forecast for FQ1 of...

    Along with reporting FQ4 results, EnerSys (NYSE:ENS) affirmed its earnings forecast for FQ1 of FY 2013. The provider of stored energy systems for industrial applications said it expects a profit of $0.88-$0.92/share, as "orders in fiscal 2013 have been trending positively, and we expect continued strong operating results." ENS +3.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • FORM

    Shares of FormFactor (NASDAQ:FORM) move up 8.8% premarket after the company updates its Q2...

    Shares of FormFactor (NASDAQ:FORM) move up 8.8% premarket after the company updates its Q2 guidance. The company ups its forecast for revenue to $50M-$54M, from a previous estimate of $43M-$47M, as it cites strong demand in its DRAM and flash memory segments.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • MON

    Monsanto (NYSE:MON) raises its FY12 EPS guidance to $3.73-3.78/share from $3.49-3.54 and vs....

    Monsanto (NYSE:MON) raises its FY12 EPS guidance to $3.73-3.78/share from $3.49-3.54 and vs. consensus of $3.56. The company sees Q3 EPS at $1.57-1.62 vs. consensus of $1.29. CEO Hugh Grant says the strong performance is about true demand from higher planted acres, and not, as possibly thought, just due to an early planting season. Shares +3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM

  • Europe erases losses, the Stoxx 50 now green after being down nearly 2% before the "banking...

    Europe erases losses, the Stoxx 50 now green after being down nearly 2% before the "banking union" news hit. Shares in Madrid are the biggest beneficiary, charging nearly 3.5% from session lows (where they were off more 7% for the week).
     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD) is raised to a Buy at Citigroup, the bank noting its 7 consecutive quarters of...

    LinkedIn (LNKD) is raised to a Buy at Citigroup, the bank noting its 7 consecutive quarters of 100% revenue growth and the opportunity provided by a 20% sell-off in the stock. Shares +2.1% premarket. (via CNBC's John Melloy)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM
  • PBY-OLD

    Pep Boys (NYSE:PBY-OLD) fell 12.5% in AH trading after announcing its planned sale to P-E firm...

    Pep Boys (NYSE:PBY-OLD) fell 12.5% in AH trading after announcing its planned sale to P-E firm Gores Group has been called off. The press release offered little by way of explanation, though Gores hinted earlier this month it was souring on the deal after a "serious deterioration" in PBY's business. Gores will pay Pep Boys a $50M breakup fee.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 AM | 2 Comments
